SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

dxf2svg
Class DxfPreprocessor

java.lang.Object
  dxf2svg.DxfPreprocessor
public final class DxfPreprocessor
extends java.lang.Object

The DxfPreprocessor instantiates and controls the multithreaded conversion environment of the DxfConverter. In addition it houses the user defined switches and the methods to alter their values. It also creates a master list of files to process through testing and collecting methods.

Version:
1.10 - October 4, 2005
Author:
Andrew Nisbet

Method Detail

readJavaScriptObjects

public boolean readJavaScriptObjects()
Retrieves JavaScript code from the config file and places it within the <script> tags of each of the converted Svg files. JavaScript objects can come in 3 different forms:
  1. Automatic language switching scripts.
  2. Scripts specified by the user with the javaScript keyword.
  3. Scripts created through the animation API (see Sally documentation).

getJavaScript

public static java.util.Vector getJavaScript()
Returns a stack of JavaScript code for incorporation into Svg files.

Returns:
null if there are no functions stored. You may want to check for the presents of JavaScript with the hasJavaScript() method.

hasJavaScript

public static boolean hasJavaScript()
Reports on whether the config file contained javaScript to be placed in the Svg file during conversion.

registerCollaboratorTarget

public static void registerCollaboratorTarget(java.lang.String name,
                                              java.lang.String collaborates)
This method allows clients to register whether a target for animation requires collaborative processing.

Parameters:
name - of the animation target (usually a layer name). Null or empty name strings are not registered. Sending an entry that already exists will over-write the previous value.
collaborates - finds other line segments share start or end points and assumes that they are all part of one entity. True - searches for collaborator line segments false - apply animation to entire layer as one group.

isCollaboratorTarget

public static boolean isCollaboratorTarget(java.lang.String name)
Returns true if the target cited by argument name is registered as requiring searches for collaborative line segments, false if the argument name is Null, an empty String, has not been registered or has been expressly set to false.

registerGangTarget

public static void registerGangTarget(java.lang.String name,
                                      java.lang.String isGang)
This method allows clients to register this layer as requiring gang wire treatment or not.

Parameters:
name - of the animation target (usually a layer name). Null or empty name strings are not registered. Sending an entry that already exists will over-write the previous value. So 'layerName' = true will over write a value already stored that says 'layerName' = false.
isGang - finds other line segments share start or end points and assumes that they are all part of one entity. True - searches for ganged polyline segments false - do nothing with <path> elements.

isGangingTarget

public static boolean isGangingTarget(java.lang.String name)
Returns true if the target cited by argument name is registered as requiring searches for polyline segments (<path>) which will be interpreted as a wire gang. If this is the case any animation will be applied to this object individually of any other gangs.

The function will return false if the argument name is Null, an empty String, has not been registered or has been expressly set to false.

getPen

public static Pen getPen(int penNum)
This method is used to retrieve a Pen reference for inclusion into a CustomLayerStyle

Throws:
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if the argument pen number is out of range.
java.lang.NullPointerException - if the Pens array has not been initialized.

Allows any conversion context to retrieve an animation engine reference.

Performs a lookup for font names within the font map.

Returns:
name Name of the replacement font name (if any).

getLayerOrder

public static java.util.Vector getLayerOrder()
Returns a list of layers that are to be put in order. The layers on this list may not even exist in a perticular drawing; if that is the case the entry is ignored.

See Also:
setLayerOrder()

getLayerOrderPlacement

public static int getLayerOrderPlacement()
The method returns an integer representation of where the list of prefered layer ordering will appear. If Dxf2SvgConstants.HEAD any layers in the drawing that match the list will be output first and therefore drawn first. If Dxf2SvgConstants.TAIL the list will appear at the end of the SVG file and therefore will be drawn last. The default is TAIL.

setLayerOrder

public boolean setLayerOrder()
This method places a set of layers in a particular order as read from the config file. This may be necessary if you require some layers to be drawn last or first depending. A good example of this is an anotation arrow on an illustration. Often the arrow will have a white space around it to make it easier to follow to the item being called out. The white 'mask' is drawn first and then the line of the arrow. To do this we must make sure that the mask layer is drawn first followed by the line layer.

The list ordering is controlled by two integers, either Dxf2SvgConstants.TAIL or Dxf2SvgConstants.HEAD. HEAD indicates that the listed layers must appear first, in order. TAIL indicates the listed layers must appear drawn last.The default is TAIL for convience and invalid integers are interpreted to be TAIL.

The layers are output according to list order until the list is exhausted and then the layers are placed in the order that the DXF file specifies.

A request to order layers by tail will win out over any request for head layer ordering - no matter where the list is placed in the config file.

convertToSvgCss

public static java.lang.String convertToSvgCss(java.lang.String src)
This method formats the argument string to match valid SVG CSS string formatting. Valid CSS strings cannot contain underscores and convensions with Dxf2Svg state that all CSS names be in lowercase. Other could be added to accomodate future developments or restrictions for CSS.

Parameters:
src - String remains untouched.
Returns:
-1 if src is null, 0 if conversion successfull and 1 if dest is null.

convertToSvgCss

public static java.lang.String convertToSvgCss(java.lang.String src,
                                               boolean isEntity)
This method formats the argument string to match valid SVG CSS string formatting. Valid CSS strings cannot contain underscores and convensions with Dxf2Svg state that all CSS names be in lowercase. Other could be added to accomodate future developments or restrictions for CSS.

Parameters:
src - String remains untouched.
isEntity - If this is an entity then any initial digit will be preceeded by an under-score. If this is not an entity it is a CSS property or declaration and will be preceeded by a 'st'.
Returns:
-1 if src is null, 0 if conversion successfull and 1 if dest is null.

getColour

public static final java.lang.String getColour(int c)
Given an Acad colour number, this method looks up its Web safe colour equivilant.

If the colour number is invalid StyleSheetGenerator issues a warning to stderr and substitutes 'fushia' (No. 220) instead.

Another feature of this method is that if AutoCAD has made the object invisible (either frozen or locked) the colour is still output correctly but the object's stroke visibility attribute should be set to hidden within the object if necessary. Also note that all colours, with the exception of white (255) can be coerced to be represented in any ohter colour with the command switch '-c'. See setCoerciveColour(int) and '-h' for more information.

Parameters:
c - Colour number as integer.
Returns:
String Web safe colour equivilant of Acad Colour as 6 hex digits prefixed with a '#'.

getCustomLayerStyle

public static final CustomLayerStyle getCustomLayerStyle(java.lang.String name)
Returns a custom layer that corresponds with the argument name.

Returns:
null if there are no custom layers defined or the argument layer is not defined in the custom layer list.

getNormalizedFileName

public static java.lang.String getNormalizedFileName(java.lang.String name)
This method takes a String name which is thought to be a file name with fully qualified path and normalizes it. Normalization means that the returned name will be lower case and will not include the file's extension or path. Example: if the argument is c:/tmp/Faaagqc.DWG the normalized version will be faaagqc

extractFigureData

protected void extractFigureData(java.util.Vector dxfFiles)
Creates a database of illustrations and their relatives. This method presearches the DXF source files for figure titles and sheet numbers - like figure 1-2 sheet 1 of 2 and figure 1-2 sheet 2 of 2.

reserializeLibrary

protected void reserializeLibrary()
Reserializes the library for future look ups.

parseFigureString

protected java.lang.String[] parseFigureString(java.lang.String sentence,
                                               int language,
                                               java.lang.String[] values)
This method returns an array of strings that contain the figure's number the sheet number and total number of sheets and the title of the illustration. This method is highly specialized and only works for titles with the following format: 'Figure x(-x(L)?(-x(L))) (\(Sheet x of x\))? Figure Title'.

Bug: It is not possible, at this time to determine which title string contains french and which is english on a bilingual drawing with both titles on the same layer 'T'. The upshot is that the french version of a bilingual illustration will have the English title in the <title> tag.

Returns:
String The figure number as a String.
Throws:
{@link - java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException} if values[].length is less than FigureSheetDatabase.NUM_FIELDS.

getBoardnoLanguage

public static int getBoardnoLanguage(java.lang.String src)
This method tests the language character for English, French or Bilingual and returns the integer value of the language.
  • Dxf2SvgConstants.UNDEFINED = -1
  • Dxf2SvgConstants.ENGLISH = 1
  • Dxf2SvgConstants.FRENCH = 2
  • Dxf2SvgConstants.MULTI_LINGUAL = 3

testFile

protected boolean testFile(java.lang.String file)
Tests if a file for the listed tests.

Currently it tests a file to see if it:
  • Is empty.
  • Does not exist.
  • Is not readable.
  • Is not writable.
  • Is a directory.
  • Is NULL.
  • Is a hidden file.

Parameters:
file - Name of the file to test as a string.
See Also:
FileTester

cssMode

public static int cssMode()
Returns current MAKE_CSS mode setting.

setCssMode

public static void setCssMode(int cssmode)
Sets current MAKE_CSS mode setting. This method has special properties. If you pass successive integers to the method they have an accumualtive effect. This is because the fields are bit fields. This doesn't cause a problem because we test for specific bit values at specific times, if there are any values added that are not defined, they are ignored.

Passing a -1 to the method will reset the bit values to the default value of Dxf2SvgConstants.DECLARED_CSS.

makeDefaultStyleSheet

public void makeDefaultStyleSheet()
Creates a 'Spar' style sheet that dictates standard line weights used by illustrators at Spar Technical Publications department. This method is called from Dxf2Svg while parsing command line options. If this method is invoked and the -f option has been set Dxf2Svg will check to see if -f's argument refers to a file or directory. If it is a file then the CSS is placed in the parent directory of the file; if it is a directory the file is place in that directory. If the -f is not used the CSS is created in the current directory.

getFileName

public static java.lang.String getFileName()
Returns current DXF_FILE setting.

setFileName

public static void setFileName(java.lang.String path)
Sets current DXF_FILE setting. The Argument is converted into a canonical (pedantic) path name to distill out references to '.', '..' and relative paths.

getConversionDirectory

public static java.lang.String getConversionDirectory()
Returns the conversion directory name as a String.

setConversionDirectory

public void setConversionDirectory(java.lang.String dir)
Explicitly sets the conversion directory. Called when conversions are run recursively.

getPrecision

public static int getPrecision()
Returns current PRECISION setting. All calculations are carried out with full precision but the user can indicate how many digits after the decimal to include in the final SVG output. It generally reduces the size of an SVG and most applications can't take advantage of the maximum precision any way.

See Also:
SvgUtil.trimDouble(double)

setPrecision

public static void setPrecision(int precision)
Returns current PRECISION setting. All calculations are carried out with full precision but the user can indicate how many digits after the decimal to include in the final SVG output. It generally reduces the size of an SVG and most applications can't take advantage of the maximum precision any way.

Parameters:
precision - Number of decimal places or scale of output number.
See Also:
SvgUtil.trimDouble(double)

setHTMLWrappers

public static void setHTMLWrappers(boolean wrappersRequired)
Sets a switch to output HTML wrappers for the SVG files. The HTML wrappers allow for better printing and add a button that will switch languages between French and English if both are present.

useHTMLWrappers

public static final boolean useHTMLWrappers()
Sets a switch to output HTML wrappers for the SVG files. The HTML wrappers allow for better printing and add a button that will switch languages between French and English if both are present.

isZipped

public static boolean isZipped()
Returns the switch setting that controls whether the SVG file will be compressed.

Returns:
true if the file is to be compressed, false otherwise.

isDatabaseDriven

public static boolean isDatabaseDriven()
Returns true if searches for family members should be made and false otherwise. False will have no effect on any output files. If useHTMLWrappers() is false this switch will have no effect.

syncDatabase

public static void syncDatabase(java.lang.String path)
Switch to allow a database in the directory of path to be updated. Using this switch will either use or create a database that will then be used to make links between drawings in the HTML wrappers. This database can also be output (as XML) to create a boardno-control.xml file for IETM conversions.

The argument path should be a directory where a file called LibraryCatalog.ser can be found. If the directory does not contain such a file, one will be created and the data from this conversion added to it.

Throws:
DxfPreprocessor.IncludeFileIOException - if the path is invalid.
java.lang.ClassCastException - if the stored data is not a LibraryCatalog or DatabaseContainer.

getUsesLinks

public static boolean getUsesLinks()
Returns the flag if the dxf contained a hyper link. Used to determine if the xlink namespace needs to be included as an entity in the <svg> tag.

setUsesLinks

public static void setUsesLinks(boolean b)
This method is used by internal processes to allow the inclusion of xlink namespace if there happens to be a hyperlink in the dxf file being converted.

isPartsListFigure

public static boolean isPartsListFigure()
Returns a flag of whether this is a parts list figure or not.

getPartsListAttribute

public static Attribute getPartsListAttribute()
Returns the user defined attribute that will be used on an anchor of a part index number in a parts list figure. Typically it is 'onclick'.

setPartsListAttribute

public void setPartsListAttribute(java.lang.String a,
                                  java.lang.String v)
This method returns the attribute value associated with the parts list attribute. Typically, in the parts list, this would be an event like onclick. NOTE: you do NOT need the closing parenthesis like a normal function. Example: where normally you would use onclick="someFunc('001')", you need only supply 'someFunc'. All other calculations and parenthesis are added by SvgDxfHyperlink.

takeNotes

public static boolean takeNotes()
Returns true if drawings are to be searched for notes and false otherwise.

setGenerateNotes

public void setGenerateNotes(boolean b)
Sets the flag to instruct the conversion to search for and incorporate notes (as pop-ups currently) in the converted SVG graphics.

setSuppressBoilerPlateJavaScriptFlag

public static void setSuppressBoilerPlateJavaScriptFlag(boolean b)
Sets the flag that will either suppress the inclusion of the default JavaScript scripts (for language selection etc.) or the default; include the scripts.

suppressBoilerPlateJavaScript

public static boolean suppressBoilerPlateJavaScript()
Returns the current setting for whether the default javascript functions will be included (default) or not.

logEvent

public static void logEvent(java.lang.String fileName,
                            java.lang.String eventString)
Logs an event to the default event file which can be found in 'c:/temp/dxf2svg_log.txt'.

Parameters:
fileName - name of the file where the event occured (but not limited to that function).
eventString - what happened; a brief description of the problem. Output each time the event occurs.

addIncludeFileName

public void addIncludeFileName(java.lang.String file)
Adds the data from the file specified by the param file inside of the <svg> tag. Use this if you wish to include a sub-SVG or javascript or what ever. Note the content of the file must be formatted as children of the SVG tag or the graphic may not display correctly.

getIncludeFileData

public static java.lang.String getIncludeFileData()
Returns a big String that contains all of the data that was contained in the include file(s).

isInclude

public static boolean isInclude()
Returns true if there is include data to be added to the SVGs, false otherwise.

setColourCoercedByLayer

public static void setColourCoercedByLayer(boolean b)
Sets any object's colour to bylayer regardless of what the illustrator requested. Often blocks will be on a correct layer and the elements in the block are set on the correct layer but their colour is set to something specific. The conversion, by default assumes that the illustrator required the element to appear as a specific colour if he set an elements colour to a specific value. This was a mistake; they seem to change an object's colour to what ever for no reason at all.

isColourCoercedByLayer

public static boolean isColourCoercedByLayer()
Returns true if the user requires all elements to be converted to represented in the colour of the layer they come from - even if the illustrator asked it to be a specific colour.

setUseGraphicLinkDatabase

public static void setUseGraphicLinkDatabase(boolean b)
Use this method to read and reference graphic links. This is done to link svg graphics to other figures in other books. This graphic link database is a large database that contains all the figureids of all the figures of all the Spar CC130 CFTOs. To create the database reference the documents for MakeExternalLinksDatabase application.

usesGraphicLinkDatabase

public static boolean usesGraphicLinkDatabase()
Returns true if the user requests the use of the external graphic links database. false otherwise.

setUpdateDatabaseOnly

public static void setUpdateDatabaseOnly(boolean update)
This method allows the user to update the boardno-control database without converting the graphics to SVG. This is done if the catalog pertinent information has changed in the dxfs but those changes don't effect the graphic information. (It speeds things up).

setSwapSvgForHtml

public void setSwapSvgForHtml(boolean swap)
This method dynamically switches any link that contain .svg(z) to .html. This is a bandaid solution to fix the fact that all links were erroneously entered to link to an svg rather than the svg's wrapper html file. Live and learn.

See Also:
setSwapSvgForHtml(boolean), SvgDxfHyperlink, SvgDxfHyperlink.setXLink(java.lang.String)

swapSvgzForHtml

public static boolean swapSvgzForHtml()
Returns true if the user wants to swap links that have .svg(z) reference to html and false otherwise.
